body: • An extract from Grit, a book by the psychologist Angela Duckworth, in last Saturday’s Family section included a table under the heading “How gritty are you?” We should have said that the copyright for the Grit scale, which Duckworth devised and used in her studies, belongs to her and that it cannot be reproduced without permission (Is grit the true secret of success?, page 5). • Images accompanying a feature on the artist and activist David Wojnarowicz in this Saturday’s Review section should have been credited to the estate of David Wojnarowicz and PPOW Gallery, New York (‘Smell the flowers while you can’, 14 May, page 20). • A report (US falling short on corruption fight, PM suggests, 13 May, page 15) misspelled Alden McLaughlin’s surname as McClaughlin, and misdescribed him as president of the Cayman Islands. He is the premier of the British Overseas Territory; it does not have a president.
